Crimes.Violation_Type: Procedural Violation of Citizenship Determination Process
Crimes.Legal_Issue: Whether the citizenship judge erred by making a determination while a removal order was pending
Crimes.Application_Facts: Applicant had a removal order stayed by IAD until June 2011; citizenship judge decided in September 2010 before final determination
Crimes.Remedy_Requested: Appeal to Federal Court for procedural fairness and correction of legal error
Crimes.Court_Ruling: Appeal allowed; original decision set aside and remanded to a different citizenship judge
Crimes.Defendant_Behavior: Citizenship judge proceeded with determination despite pending admissibility process
Crimes.Grounds_for_Claim: Violation of statutory prohibition under s. 14(1.1) of the Citizenship Act
Crimes.Legal_Standard: Statutory interpretation of s. 14(1.1), procedural fairness
Crimes.Assessment_Factor: Timing of citizenship determination relative to finality of removal order
Crimes.Procedural_Issue: Determination made without final resolution of removal order
Crimes.Review_Standard: Correctness for questions of law, reasonableness for procedural decisions
Crimes.Evidence_Used: Stay of removal order issued by IAD
Crimes.Application_Basis: Eligibility for citizenship under pending immigration status
Crimes.Evidence_Assessed: Existence and effect of IAD stay on removal order
Crimes.Relief_Sought: Redetermination of citizenship application by a different judge
Crimes.Governing_Rule: A citizenship judge cannot make a determination during an ongoing admissibility hearing until final decision on removal order
Crimes.Outcome: Original decision invalidated due to premature determination
Crimes.Harm_Assessment: Prejudice to applicant due to denial of fair opportunity to complete citizenship process
Crimes.Cause_Description: Applicant's citizenship application was denied due to an existing removal order despite a stay granted by IAD
Crimes.Evidence_Handling: Failure to account for interim stay of removal order in decision-making
Crimes.Jurisdictional_Issue: Lack of jurisdiction to decide citizenship while removal order is unresolved
Crimes.Evidence_Assessment: IAD stay recognized but not properly integrated into citizenship eligibility assessment
Crimes.Decision_Rationale: Statutory bar under s. 14(1.1) requires finality before citizenship determination
Crimes.Legal_Standard_Applied: Correctness in interpreting statutory limits on jurisdiction

Crimes.Violation_Type: Procedural Violation of Citizenship Determination Process
Crimes.Legal_Issue: Whether the citizenship judge erred by determining the application while a removal order was pending
Crimes.Application_Facts: Applicant had a removal order stayed by IAD, awaiting final determination; judge decided prematurely
Crimes.Remedy_Requested: Appeal under Federal Courts Act and Citizenship Act
Crimes.Court_Ruling: Appeal allowed; original decision set aside and case referred back for redetermination
Crimes.Defendant_Behavior: Citizenship judge issued decision before final resolution of removal order
Crimes.Grounds_for_Claim: Violation of subsection 14(1.1) of the Citizenship Act
Crimes.Assessment_Factor: Finality of removal order as precondition for citizenship determination
Crimes.Procedural_Issue: Premature decision-making during ongoing admissibility proceedings
Crimes.Evidence_Used: Stay of removal order from IAD
Crimes.Application_Basis: Eligibility based on permanent resident status subject to removal
Crimes.Evidence_Assessed: Status of removal order and validity of stay
Crimes.Relief_Sought: Redetermination by a different citizenship judge after final IAD decision
Crimes.Governing_Rule: No citizenship determination permitted during pending admissibility hearing until final removal decision
Crimes.Harm_Assessment: Unfair denial of citizenship rights due to premature adjudication
Crimes.Cause_Description: Applicant's removal order was issued but stayed by the IAD, leading to premature citizenship application denial
Crimes.Evidence_Handling: Insufficient consideration of the legal effect of the IAD stay
Crimes.Jurisdictional_Issue: Exercise of authority without proper jurisdiction under statute
Crimes.Evidence_Assessment: Recognition of stay but failure to suspend determination accordingly
Crimes.Decision_Rationale: Statute clearly prohibits citizenship decisions during unresolved removal processes
Crimes.Legal_Standard_Applied: Correctness in statutory interpretation of s. 14(1.1)
